techmeme.title: Q&A with Pavel Durov on Telegram, his arrest, censorship, not using a phone, Romanian elections, VK, encryption, Edward Snowden, spring 2018 poisoning, and more (Lex Fridman)
SAG-AFTRA criticizes AI-generated actress Tilly Norwood, the subject of a viral UK TV show parody, saying it opposes replacing performers with "synthetics" (Thomas Buckley/Bloomberg)
Epic says Apple's iOS 18.6 "updated user experience" for alt app marketplaces increased installations "for the first time", cutting drop-offs from 65% to ~25% (Jess Weatherbed/The Verge)
Tether CEO Paolo Ardoino says the company plans to distribute its new USAT token on Rumble to capture US market share; Tether holds a 48% stake in Rumble (Suvashree Ghosh/Bloomberg)
Swedish AI startups Sana, set to be acquired by Workday, Lovable, and Legora, highlight a key dilemma in Europe's tech scene: sell out or bet on becoming huge (Richard Milne/Financial Times)
